feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:14PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 20 at 10:04PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * WHAT...Surf of 10 to 13 feet. * WHERE...South and east facing shores of all islands. * WHEN...through Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor. Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebreak, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 21 at 9:05AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA MONDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 9:40AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR CONNECTICUT... Due to moderate to severe drought conditions, ground fuels and soil moisture are very dry. This has lead to an increased potential for the development and spread of brush fires today.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:27AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. A few locations may briefly reach 110 degrees this afternoon. entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued August 21 at 6:33AM PDT until August 22 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS EXPECTED ACROSS EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... .A disturbance crossing the area tonight is expected to result in isolated thunderstorms overnight becoming scattered during the day on Monday. Abundant lightning is a possibility... especially over the Blue Mountains and Wallowa County.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Blue Mountains of Washington; Lower Columbia Basin; Southeast Washington Grande Ronde Valley
